context.premise: A librarian discovers books can transport readers into their stories
context.title: The Archivist's Gambit
outline: Elias Thorne, a reclusive librarian, discovers an ancient, leather-bound book that doesn't just tell a story—it physically pulls him into its world of crystalline cities and sentient machines. He struggles to distinguish between the narrative's predetermined plot and his own free will, realizing he can feel the story's structure like a physical presence.

After a harrowing escape back to his library, Elias finds a second book and learns he is not the only 'reader' who can cross over; a clandestine organization hunts for these narrative gateways to rewrite history. He must choose between destroying the books to protect reality or using their power to enter a story and correct a past personal tragedy, a choice that will alter the very fabric of existence.
